suggestionHistory.suggestion: Create a codebase index in index.md that maps out: 1) Core system architecture (analyzers → generators → altitude), 2) API routes and their purposes, 3) Key data flows (analyze → generate → complete), 4) Component relationships, 5) Database schema overview. Include a visual ASCII diagram of the system flow.

Start the dev server with `npm run dev` and test the full analyze → generate flow. Try edge cases: malformed repos, huge codebases (>100 files), rapid API calls. Check for memory leaks in streaming responses and validate error boundaries work. Monitor network tab for unnecessary API calls.

Write unit tests for the remaining generators in lib/orion/generators/: security.ts, testing.ts, cicd.ts, and readme.ts. Follow the same pattern as the analyzer tests - test each template generation function with different gap scenarios.
Run the E2E tests with `npm run test:e2e` and check if all API endpoints pass. If they do, advance to SHIP phase. If not, show me the failures.
Check test coverage with vitest --coverage. Focus on untested generator functions and error paths in API routes. Add tests for edge cases in altitude calculations and generator error handling.

Show me the current test failures from vitest. Look at the terminal output or run `pnpm test` to see which specific tests are failing, then fix the implementation to make them pass. Focus on the analyzer tests first since those were recently modified.

Run vitest and check test results. Focus on any failing analyzer or generator tests, particularly the recently modified files (analyzers/generators). If tests pass, run `npm run typecheck` to ensure type safety.
Run vitest to see test failures. Focus on the actual error messages - likely issues with imports, TypeScript types, or test setup. Run with: npm test

Run 'npm test' to execute the test suite. If tests fail, analyze the failures and fix them. Once passing, run 'npm run test:watch' in coverage mode to check test coverage percentage and identify untested code paths.
Run 'npm test' to verify all tests pass. Fix any failing tests, focusing on the analyzer, altitude, and security test suites. Ensure TypeScript compilation succeeds with 'npm run typecheck'.

Create a comprehensive codebase index showing: 1) Component dependency graph 2) API endpoint mapping 3) Database schema relationships 4) Test coverage gaps. Focus on identifying which analyzers are incomplete and which generators need implementation.

Read docs/codebase-index.md and summarize: 1) The main architectural patterns used, 2) Key dependencies between modules, 3) The top 3 implementation gaps that need addressing. Then update the index with any missing critical files or patterns you discover.

Create a codebase index showing: 1) Key directories and their purposes, 2) Core user flows (analyze repo → view results → upgrade → export PDF), 3) API route organization pattern, 4) Component hierarchy, 5) Database schema relationships. Focus on identifying gaps between current implementation and PRD requirements.

Create a comprehensive test suite starting with the core analyzer functions. Write tests for lib/orion/analyzer.ts and lib/orion/analyzers/security.ts using Vitest. Cover the analyzeRepository function, altitude calculations, and security gap detection. Include test cases for different tech stacks and missing implementations.

Create .cursorrules for this Next.js/TypeScript project. Include: file naming conventions (kebab-case for files, PascalCase for components), import order (react → next → external → @/ aliases → relative), error handling patterns (try-catch with sanitized messages for production), TypeScript strict mode requirements, Tailwind class organization, API route structure with proper validation using Zod, and testing requirements with Vitest.

Create a .cursorrules file for this Next.js/TypeScript project. Include: TypeScript strict mode conventions, React component patterns (prefer function components with TypeScript), API route error handling patterns, Prisma best practices, consistent naming (camelCase for functions/variables, PascalCase for components/types), import order conventions, and testing requirements with Vitest.
